summary:
I am a Mechatronics R&D Engineer until recently working at Cadac Group, a leading provider of software solutions for design, engineering, and construction. I have over a year of experience in developing and integrating innovative mechatronic systems for various industries, using software development and cloud computing skills.

My passion for knowledge, understanding, and science drives me to explore the unknown, experiment, learn new skills, and creatively solve complex problems. Furthermore, I have a unique background in 3D computer graphics, animation, and concept design, which I acquired in Israel while working on my own short film. I also have a professional diploma in CGI and a bachelor's degree in Mechatronics Engineering with honours. I aim to fuse science, engineering, storytelling, research, and a dash of magic into one bright spark of light.

treasury_media.title: Embedded Systems Project - Using a SoC FPGA board for writing drivers
treasury_media.description:
Advanced Embedded Systems - A part of my study's last semester projects. An experimentation assignment using a Zybo SoC FPGA board to write drivers for a rotary encoder (grey encoding), electric switches, and a WS2812B neopoxel ring.

This board is based on the Zynq ecosystem. Everything was written in VHDL & C.

treasury_media.title: Last semester group project: Restoration of a unique high-speed H-Drive system
treasury_media.description: The machine was completely out of order. Several teams before us attempted to "revive" it, yet we were the first (and only) group to accomplish this goal, including costum PCBs, extensive documentation, and a new up-to-code safety system. Basic movement tests were successful, allowing future teams to progress with implementation of a robust control system.

treasury_media.title: Mechatronic & Cross-Platform Environment Inspection System
treasury_media.description:
For my 3rd year internship at Cadac, I've developed a mechatronic environment inspection platform. 3D models are captured at a semi-live capacity via the Zed 2 stereoscopic camera, and later automatically overlayed on top of the original CAD design of the environment in question. This allowed for quick visual inspection & comparison against its as-is state.

Here is a video demonstration of an early prototype:
https://youtu.be/SOKw83WlIfQ

treasury_media.title: Animatronic Eye Mechanism
treasury_media.description:
This is my first attempt at an animatronic eye mechanism based on Will Cogley's design! 
Was a very fun project so far :)

The eyes are printed in glow-in-the-dark PLA and the rest is PETG.

treasury_media.title: Astrotracker - 01
treasury_media.description:
This is a special mount for DSLR / System cameras which allows the camera to synchronize with the earth's rotation speed.
As a result, you can take long exposure images of the night's sky.

profile_positions.title: The Allspark

profile_positions.description:
My Family's amazing company: Effect Costumes.
Since I was about 12 years old, I have started working at our shop after school during the busy season and a bit before it in order to help my parents prepare everything (+- 3 months).
Our shop is quite unique. Almost everything is imported or self made and you will not find any other shop like it in Israel.
We have an immense variety of costumes, masks, props, makeup and so on - All in professional quality and grade. During the year, we work a lot with professionals, event runners actors and entertainment production companies and help them bring that magic to life.
During the holiday season, Purim / Halloween, the shop holds its largest selection and the doors are fully opened to the public.
One of the things we pride ourselves over is the personal attention / touch / service that we offer our magic-seekers. So many people arrive, that at some point, in order to maintain a pleasant experience and service at the shop, we must close the doors until customers are done and space is available again.
As a result, queues of up to 300 people or more can form outside of the shop.
While exhausting, I also highly enjoyed helping my family at the shop. I served as an extension of my parents and got to use my creativity to help our customers transform into their hearts' desires, even if the costume was not readily available! That is one of the shop's strengths! We have so many different props and accessories, that with a creative approach, you can solve any problem and fulfill anyone's dreams.
Apparently I was good at what I did, since many customers came back year after year looking for me, even after I couldn't come and help anymore. It's nice to know that I managed to create a positive experience for so many people :)

While I would have loved to go and keep helping my parents at the shop every year, since moving to the Netherlands, starting to study and becoming a father - my yearly adventure at Effect sadly had to end.

profile_positions.description:
What is magic? I believe it exists all around us. In nature. In animals and in human ingenuity. 
Prior to this study, I have spent most of my earlier life busy with creating and using my imagination and creativity to make things come to life. I self-taught myself a large array of CAD / CGI software for over 7 years and once out of the army, sought to develop my skills further and take things to the next level.
That's where IAC came in. I wished to create world and creatures and quite literally blur the lines between our world and the veil of magic many of us do not often notice.

During this study I sought to learn, keep up with the college tasks, research, explore and learn as much as possible. Use the staff and class' knowledge to expand my horizons. Take any small task and make it Orribly Gigantic ;)
I often broke the conventions and achieved things that my teachers / staff thought to be unrealistic or night impossible.
